SEARCH
Package nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.renderer

Class PlayerRenderer

java.lang.Object
nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.renderer.PlayerRenderer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable
public class PlayerRenderer extends Object implements Renderable
The `PlayerRenderer class is responsible for rendering the player character on the game board. It implements the `Renderable` interface, defining the rendering behavior for game elements. This class manages the rendering of the player character using provided data such as the player object, tile size, and icon folder. It supports rendering the player character facing different directions.
See Also:

    • PlayerRenderer

      public PlayerRenderer(Player player, int tileSize, String iconFolder)
      Constructs a `PlayerRenderer` object with the given player, tile size, and icon folder.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity to be rendered.
      tileSize - The size of each tile in pixels.
      iconFolder - The folder path where player icons are located.

      Renders the player character on the specified graphics context.
      Specified by:
      render in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context on which the player character should be rendered.

    • renderPlayer

      public void renderPlayer(Graphics g, int startRow, int startCol, int playerRow, int playerCol, int tileSize)
      Renders the player character within focus region of the game board.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context on which to render the player character.
      startRow - The starting row of the region.
      startCol - The starting column of the region.
      playerRow - The row position of the player character.
      playerCol - The column position of the player character.
      tileSize - The size of each tile in pixels.
